destinations.name: Kedarnath
destinations.description: Kedarnath is a sacred Hindu pilgrimage site in Uttarakhand, India, known for its ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, nestled in the majestic Himalayas.

attractions.name: Kedarnath Temple
attractions.description: A major shrine of Hinduism, located at an altitude of 3,583 m, surrounded by snow-capped mountains.
attractions.tips: Visit early in the morning for a peaceful experience.

destinations.name: Agra
destinations.description: Agra is a historic city in Uttar Pradesh, India, famous for the iconic Taj Mahal, a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of the Seven Wonders of the World.

attractions.name: Taj Mahal
attractions.description: The Taj Mahal is a white marble mausoleum built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal.
attractions.entry_fees: INR 50 for Indian citizens, INR 1100 for foreign tourists
attractions.tips: Visit early morning to avoid the crowds.

destinations.name: Goa
destinations.description: Goa is a popular coastal state in western India, known for its stunning beaches, vibrant nightlife, Portuguese heritage, and laid-back atmosphere.

attractions.name: Baga Beach
attractions.description: One of the most popular beaches in Goa, known for its lively atmosphere and water sports.
attractions.tips: Visit in the evening for beach shacks and nightlife.

destinations.name: Rajasthan
destinations.description: Rajasthan is a vibrant state in northwest India, known for its rich cultural heritage, grand palaces, majestic forts, and expansive deserts, reflecting the royal history of the Rajput kings.

attractions.name: Jaipur (The Pink City)
attractions.description: Jaipur’s enchanting blend of history, culture, and vibrant urban life makes it a captivating destination for travelers seeking to experience the essence of Rajasthan.
attractions.entry_fees: Separate fees for Indian citizens and foreign tourists. Additional fees for photography.
attractions.tips: Elephant Ride: Experience an elephant ride up to the fort entrance.Guide: Hire a guide to learn about the fort’s history and architectural details.

attractions.name: Hawa Mahal
attractions.description: The Palace of Winds, known for its unique façade with numerous windows allowing royal ladies to observe street life discreetly.
what_to_see: The intricate latticework and panoramic views of the city from the upper floors.
attractions.tips: Visit early in the morning or late afternoon for the best light and fewer crowds.

destinations.name: Kashmir
destinations.description: Kashmir is a picturesque region in northern India, renowned for its stunning landscapes, lush valleys, and the serene beauty of its lakes and mountains, often referred to as Paradise on Earth.

attractions.name: Dal Lake
attractions.description: A famous lake in Srinagar known for its houseboats, shikaras, and picturesque views.
attractions.tips: Best time to visit is early morning for a peaceful shikara ride.

attractions.name: Gulmarg
attractions.description: A popular skiing destination in winter and a beautiful meadow in summer.
attractions.entry_fees: Free (Skiing and Gondola ride charges apply)
attractions.tips: Visit in winter for skiing or in summer for a pleasant retreat.

destinations.name: India Gate
destinations.description: India Gate is a prominent war memorial in New Delhi, India, honoring the soldiers of the British Indian Army who died in World War I, and is a symbol of national pride and sacrifice.

attractions.name: India Gate
attractions.description: A 42-meter-high archway located at the heart of New Delhi, surrounded by lush gardens.
attractions.tips: Visit in the evening to see the monument beautifully illuminated.

attractions.name: Rajpath
attractions.description: A ceremonial boulevard that leads to Rashtrapati Bhavan, used for the annual Republic Day parade.
attractions.tips: Walk down Rajpath for a majestic view of India Gate and Rashtrapati Bhavan.
